intro: Nemastylis mcvaughii, commonly known as the McVaugh's nemastylis, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
